Government House Land Act 1964

An Act to dedicate certain land and reserve it as a site for the residence of the Governor
[Royal Assent 5 August 1964]

Be it enacted by His Excellency the Governor of Tasmania, by and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and House of Assembly, in Parliament assembled, as follows:

1. Short title
    This Act may be cited as the Government House Land Act 1964 .

2. Dedication of Government House land
    The piece of land that is described in Schedule 1 is by force of this section –
            (a) dedicated for the purpose of being used as a site for the residence of the Governor and for purposes incidental thereto; and
            (ab) dedicated for the purpose of being used, including by leasing out of part of the land or the use under licence, or by other authority, of part of the land, to raise revenue to be applied for the maintenance and preservation of the site and the residence; and
            (b) reserved for all time for those purposes –
    and shall not be used for any other purpose.
